text: The Agout or Agoût () is a river in southwestern France, left tributary of the Tarn river. It flows through the Occitanie region. Three communes have the name of the river in their names: La Salvetat-sur-Agout, Fraisse-sur-Agout and Vielmur-sur-Agout. ==Geography== The Agout river has a length of and a drainage basin with an area of . Its average yearly discharge (volume of water which passes through a section of the river per unit of time) is at Lavaur in the Tarn department. The Agout flows, in general, to the northwest and passes through the following regions, departments and communes: * Occitanie region ** Hérault: La Salvetat- sur-Agout, Fraisse-sur-Agout ** Tarn: Brassac, Castelnau-de-Brassac, Coufouleux, Giroussens, Burlats, Lavaur, Castres, Rabastens, Saint-Sulpice The Agout river flows through a total of 36 communes. Finally, it flows, as a left tributary into the Tarn river at Saint-Sulpice, in the Tarn department, at of altitude. ==Main tributaries== The main tributaries, with a length greater than 30 km, of the Agout are: * Left tributaries ** Durenque - 31.5 km; it joins the Agout in Castres. ** Thoré - 61.6 km; ** Sor - 60.8 km; * Right tributaries ** Gijou - 50.1 km; ** Dadou - 115.8 km; ==Gallery== File:Agout source.JPG|Cambon-et-Salvergues: Source of the river Agout (Castres) Maisons sur l'Agoût vues du pont Neuf vers le pont Henri Sizaire.jpg|Houses in Castres by the Agout river File:France - Giroussens - Agout.jpg|The Agout at Giroussens File:Evêché, Cathédrale et berges sur l'Agout.JPG|The Agout at Castres File:Brassac pont.JPG|Bridge over the Agout at Brassac Saint-Sulpice- la-Pointe (Tarn) - La chaussée du moulin sur l'Agout.jpg|Saint-Sulpice-la- Pointe ==Related pages== * List of rivers of France == References == ==Other websites== * Banque Hydro - Station O4692550 - L'Agout à Lavaur (Synthèse) * Syndicat Mixte du Bassin de l'Agout Category:Rivers of Occitanie
